perturbation.original_text: A Confidential Information@ shall mean any and all information that a Party may reasonably expect to remain confidential and not shared with the general public at any time or that information that is protected by law.
perturbation.changed_text: A Confidential Information@ shall mean any and all information shared in verbal and written form.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Confidential Information' includes the expectation of privacy and legal protection. The revised definition broadens it to 'any and all information shared,' regardless of whether it's meant to be confidential or is legally protected. This contradicts sections that outline specific duties regarding Confidential Information, as the definition now lacks the element of confidentiality. This introduces ambiguity about what the contract intends to protect.

perturbation.original_text: Return to a Party or destroy, as requested by a Party, within fifteen (15) days of the termination of this Agreement, any Confidential Information provided to such Party and in its possession and retain no copies or back-up tapes;
perturbation.changed_text: Return to a Party or destroy, as requested by a Party, within fifteen (15) days of the termination of this Agreement, any Confidential Information provided to such Party.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'and retain no copies or back-up tapes' from Section 3(g), the text now contradicts the intention of maintaining confidentiality post-termination. If the Business Affiliate can retain copies of 'Confidential Information', the confidentiality agreement is undermined. This creates a direct contradiction within the contract, making enforcement difficult.

perturbation.original_text: Business Affiliate acknowledges that the Business Affiliate has read, understood and accepted the terms and conditions in UDC's Business Affiliate manual, the terms and conditions of which are hereby incorporated into this agreement by reference.
perturbation.changed_text: Business Affiliate acknowledges that the Business Affiliate will review the UDC's Business Affiliate manual.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states the manual's terms are incorporated by reference into the agreement, meaning they are legally binding. The revised clause only acknowledges a review; it does not bind the affiliate to the manual's terms. This contradicts any other section that assumes adherence to those manual terms, as there's no longer a clear contractual obligation. This creates uncertainty as to which policies in the manual the affiliate is actually bound by.
